taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.rightsHolder: FishBase
dataObjects.description: Juveniles and subadults may be found in brackish water of river mouths.  Found on soft bottoms (Ref. 5217).  Feeds on fish (Ref. 27188).  Stomach contents are said to include parts of monkeys.  In parts of the Amazon, this catfish occasionally makes prey of a man (Ref. 6868).  Flesh considered excellent quality (Ref. 5217).  Captured using nets and longlines (Ref.  35381).  Threatened due to over harvesting (Ref. 58490).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.rightsHolder: FishBase
dataObjects.description: South America:  Amazon and Orinoco River basins and major rivers of the Guianas and northeastern Brazil.  Reported from Argentina (Ref. 9086).
dataObjects.references: Lundberg, J.G. and M.W. Littmann 2003 Pimelodidae (Long-whiskered catfishes). p. 432-446. In R.E. Reis, S.O. Kullander and C.J. Ferraris, Jr. (eds.) Checklist of the Freshwater Fishes of South and Central America. Porto Alegre: EDIPUCRS, Brasil. (Ref. 36506)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.rightsHolder: FishWise Professional
dataObjects.description: Amazon and Orinoco River basins and major rivers of Guianas and northeastern Brazil: Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, French Guiana, Peru, Suriname and Venezuela.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.rightsHolder: FishWise Professional

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.rightsHolder: FishBase
dataObjects.description: 360 cm TL (male/unsexed; (Ref. 36506)); max. published weight: 200.0 kg (Ref. 27188)
dataObjects.references: Lundberg, J.G. and M.W. Littmann 2003 Pimelodidae (Long-whiskered catfishes). p. 432-446. In R.E. Reis, S.O. Kullander and C.J. Ferraris, Jr. (eds.) Checklist of the Freshwater Fishes of South and Central America. Porto Alegre: EDIPUCRS, Brasil. (Ref. 36506)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Migration
dataObjects.rightsHolder: FishBase
dataObjects.description: Potamodromous. Migrating within streams, migratory in rivers, e.g. Saliminus, Moxostoma, Labeo.  Migrations should be cyclical and predictable and cover more than 100 km.
